title: Need Help IDing a Beveled Font
content:
Anyone know what font was used for this logo?

I'd appreciate any help!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [SOACGMG029 White\_Small.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023163339/http:/typophile.com/files/SOACGMG029%20White_Small.jpg) | 591.36 KB |
author: FGG42

comments.content:
Style is variously known as beveled, chiseled, prismatic.  
Didn't find the exact one but [Shango Chiseled](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023163339/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/castletype/shango-chiseled/) is close.  
Don

Those might be be good options - thanks for your help! I hadn't found either of those in after looking for a while yesterday. If anyone has any more good choices, that'd be great.

Thanks again!
This always felt like a modified [Eagle](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023163339/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Eagle/) (Font Bureau) to me. With the W flipped to form the M, perhaps.
